course.subject: CIVL
course.name: Travel Demand Analysis
course.description: Overview of transportation planning process; population/employment forecasting techniques; discrete choice models; simplified transportation demand models.

reviews.author: alienfiretruck
reviews.title: Note that this review is for postgraduate course CIEM 5620, but both course should be similar
reviews.comment_content:
The course is more on statistics and algebra, would be a good choice if you have strong mathematical sense.

Professor would prove every concept discussed in class for extra learning, though the proof would not be asked in examination and it might not be useful in practice.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is quite nice and could see that he tried to improve his teaching. The lectures were not starting late now. Professor's accent might be difficult to understand at first but he always explain until most students understand the concept.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is fairly lenient. Did not do my best in the 4 assignments (not scoring full mark every time) and UQ score in examination, ended up with an A.
reviews.comment_workload:
4 assignments (20%) and 1 examination (80%) for CIEM 5620, might be different to undergraduate course but I believe they are very similar.

Workload is pretty low as assignments are easy, just to test your general understanding on the concepts. Answers could also be found in the lecture notes.

reviews.author: Evanllll
reviews.comment_content:
having two-part
and profs will give your review content
you have to really learn knowledge, the content is not too much but you need to know more details about the content.
The final exam is "different" from the homework. (you have to study hard)
by the way, you don't have enough time to think during the final exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
20% for HW
80% for final exam
Final exam need more time to review
reviews.comment_workload:
total 4 HW
not to hard but you need spend time to do.
you can find steps from PPT
